title: Mobile Microlearning Language Course Based on Integrated Instructional Design: Application of Direct Instruction and Constructivism

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension) and specialized professional experience in the field
context.additional_context: Short-term language courses for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields conducted in BYOD environments. The curriculum focuses on acquiring domain-specific terminology and improving practical document-writing skills aligned with learners' professional contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish between four learning types (receptive, immersive, constructive, integrative) and apply them appropriately to language learning contexts
Learners complete microlearning modules combining direct instruction and constructivist approaches at over 85% completion, systematically acquiring vocabulary and grammatical structures

Learners can design domain-specific language utilization strategies (medical/legal/technical) according to the four knowledge domains of the Cynefin Framework (Simple/Known, Chaotic, Complex, Complicated)

Learners submit integrated language performance (speaking, writing, listening) based on corporate project scenarios (e.g., global negotiation, report writing) within one week, achieving at least 4 points per criterion (total 16/20) on the evaluation rubric (communication clarity, task appropriateness, linguistic accuracy, text structuring ability) to demonstrate integrated language proficiency in real-world work contexts
Learners can analyze their personal learning curves to develop self-directed language learning plans
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
